text: Kenneth Earl Rice (September 14, 1939 - October 14, 2020) was an American professional football player. He was an offensive tackle in the American Football League (AFL) for the Buffalo Bills, Oakland Raiders, and the Miami Dolphins. Rice played college football for the Auburn Tigers, where he was named a two-time All-American. He was born in Attapulgus, Georgia. Rice died on October 14, 2020 in Canton, Georgia at the age of 81.Two-time Auburn All- American Ken Rice passes away ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:Buffalo Bills players Category:Oakland Raiders players Category:Miami Dolphins players Category:American football offensive tackles Category:American football offensive guards Category:Sportspeople from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Ken Rice (American football)
